sentences.en: ...owing to the slow tempo of change in an overwhelmingly rural country.
sentences.cn: …由于一个高度农业化国家变革的缓慢速度。

sentences.en: And the tempo of the sea speeded up.
sentences.cn: 同时大海的起伏动荡加剧了.

sentences.en: Both teams played with a lot of quality, pace and tempo.
sentences.cn: 两支球队的水平都很高，节奏和速度都很快。

sentences.en: Elgar supplied his works with precise indications of tempo.
sentences.cn: 埃尔加给自己的作品标上了精确的节奏标记。

sentences.en: In a new recording, the Boston Philharmonic tried the original tempo.
sentences.cn: 在新唱片中，波士顿爱乐乐团尝试了全新的节奏。

sentences.en: It's got a quick tempo, a nice rhythm , and a heavy beat.
sentences.cn: 他的音乐速度快, 有节奏感, 节拍很强烈.

sentences.en: Suppose that we quicken the tempo of human life till men are senile at thirty.
sentences.cn: 假定我们就是要加速人生的速度,使得人满三十就衰老.

sentences.en: The boss is unsatisfied with the tardy tempo.
sentences.cn: 老板不满于这种缓慢的进度.

sentences.en: the easy tempo of island life
The tempo has been stepped up.
sentences.cn: 速度一点点地加快起来了.

sentences.en: The tempo must not be reduced!
The tune has a fast tempo.
They increased the tempo of their key changes, from every 15 days to every day.
sentences.cn: 他们的密码底改变得越来越快, 从十五天一变改为一天一变.

sentences.en: They waltz to the tempo of the music.
sentences.cn: 他们跟着音乐的节奏跳华尔兹舞.

sentences.en: To slacken the tempo would mean falling behind.
sentences.cn: 放松步伐就意味着落后.

sentences.en: We won't let any unreasonable delay upset the tempo of production.
sentences.cn: 我们决不容许任何毫无道理的迟延扰乱了生产的发展速度.

trans.tran_cn: [乐]速度，拍子，（运动或活动的）速度，进度，（下棋的）一着，一步
trans.tran_en: the speed at which music is played or should be played
